trust_OR: most managers judge a little too harshly and are naturally untrusting

MC Human OR: The manager monitors and adjusts the algorithm but the algorithm has the final say in the process of scheduling.
fairness_OR: The algorithm takes what availability Chris has and the needs of the coffee shop and figures out what hours to schedule him.  I think it is fair because it takes both Chris's needs and the coffee shop's needs and figures out the best shift for both of them.
emotion_OR: Chris's availability was factored into the scheduling so he should be happy.  They didn't just assign him a schedule per the coffee shop's needs, they actually listened to him.
trust_OR: It is a computer and not a person making the scheduling decision.  It isn't biased.
algorithm definition: I think algorithms are a computer program that factors in whatever information you provide it and give back the best answer based on the information provided.

fairness_OR: The algorithm chose at random and Chris is qualified.
emotion_OR: I think Chris would feel somewhat indifferent about the task.  It is a job that needs to be done.
trust_OR: I think the algorithm was more than likely designed to make the best decisions in each given situation.
algorithm definition: Algorithms are programs/trackers that determine certain outcomes in certain situations based upon what they were programmed to do.

MC Human OR: The algorithm selects the top applicants and the manager looks through personal statements.
fairness_OR: It's very fair because it finds the most qualified candidates to be screened onsite. It doesn't make sense for managers to be sorting through resumes all the time that may not have people that are qualified for the jobs they are applying for.
emotion_OR: As long as Chris is qualified, I don't believe he would mind this occuring and I would hope he would only want jobs in which he was qualified and would excel.
trust_OR: I don't always trust computers and their processes 100%.
algorithm definition: Computerized processes that weed through paperwork by looking for key words or phrases.

MC Human OR: The manger assigned humans to monitor the components the algorithm thought would have maintenance issues.
fairness_OR: It seems unbiased.
emotion_OR: I think Chris would feel mostly neutral.
trust_OR: I think he will stay mostly unbiased.
algorithm definition: Mathmatical formulas using multiple variables.

MC Human OR: The manager analyzed the personal statement, while the algorithm chose the top applicants from their resumes. From there on-site interviews were scheduled.
fairness_OR: It seems fair to use an algorithm to find people that meet specific qualifications. However, not giving the whole resume consideration seems slightly unfair. The algorithm cannot take in everything that a human can.
emotion_OR: I don't think Chris would have any positive feelings about this process, but I don't think he'd feel strongly negative ones either.
trust_OR: As I noted before, simply flagging keywords can result in a good candidate falling through the cracks.
algorithm definition: A computer program that analyzes information using specific keywords.

MC Human OR: The algorithm chose the hours and times the employees would work based on the information it has.The manager's role was to pay attention to the amount of customers each day so the algorithm could create his schedule.
fairness_OR: If the algorithm is efficient, then I do not see how it could be unfair at all.
emotion_OR: I have no reason to believe why he would feel frustrated, or upset about anything. I can see how he would be somewhat happy, but not quite joyful and proud.
trust_OR: Again, I have no reason to believe the alogrithm does not do a good job, or I would assume the coffee shop would no longer be using it.
algorithm definition: Computer programs made up of a specific set of information used to solve problems.

MC Human OR: The manager gave input and the algorithm made the final quality task assignments.
fairness_OR: It seems fair based on best practices for the factory to use the algorithm to assign the task. The algorithm may be less prone to human error or bias.
emotion_OR: His feelings would be positive, having a job to do and believing the assignment of the task was well made.
trust_OR: I trust that the many decisions made by humans programming the algorithm resulted in a product that has the expertise and understanding, combined with the manager's input, to make the best decision on task assignments.
algorithm definition: a set of rules that govern an operation or function.

MC Human OR: The algorithm gathers data and evaluates the output; the manager evaluates the algorithm.
fairness_OR: Much of Chris's job involves working with computers and their output either exists or it doesn't.  Technical evaluations are fait.
emotion_OR: He might be pleased overall, but have identified some computer glitches that hold him back.
trust_OR: It is largely objective but doesn't account for crashing or other glitches.
algorithm definition: programs that evaluate data

trust_OR: If the company uses it it must work somewhat well

MC Human OR: The algorithm judge the calls and comments and the manager uses that to evaluate Chris.

MC Human OR: The managers job was to listen to the algorithms decisions.
fairness_OR: He didn't target chris personally, as long as the algorithm targets characteristics that are legal then there is no problem.
